p: Results from the Permutation Importance analyses ( Table 1) show that the model for the lowland N. rafflesiana is driven primarily by mean temperature of the warmest quarter (26.5%) and precipitation of the wettest quarter (30.23%). In contrast, the model for the highland N. tentaculata is driven primarily by minimum temperature of the coldest month (30.57%), mean temperature of the coldest quarter (37.85%), and annual precipitation (22.31%).
